carousel.title: Realization of a Robot that Works in Turns with Humans

member.title: Members
member.professorBio: In 2002, received a Ph.D. in Engineering from Kyushu Institute of Technology. In 2002, became an Assistant Professor at Kyushu Institute of Technology. In 2013, became an Associate Professor at the same university. In 2018, served as a visiting researcher at LORIA and a visiting researcher at the University of Salento. In 2019, became a director of KiQ Robotics Inc. In 2020, became a specially appointed professor at Kyushu Institute of Technology. In 2021, founded Nishida Lab. In 2022, became a professor at the University of Kitakyushu. In 2024, became CEO of Roboappli Inc.

contact.contact1: Inquiries for Joint Research and Interviews
contact.contact2: For those wishing to join Nishida Lab as students

research.title: Our Research
research.vision: Our lab aims to contribute to society through robotics technology. We strive to realize intelligent robots that can adapt to the real world, working on both applied and fundamental research.

pathPlanning.title: Path Planning
pathPlanning.desc: We develop algorithms that enable robots to compute safe and efficient paths to destinations, including obstacle avoidance and dynamic environment adaptation.

measurement3D.title: 3D Measurement
measurement3D.desc: We focus on techniques to acquire and process 3D spatial information using sensors like LiDAR and stereo cameras.
